text.content:
Inpatient Note 
 
     ==============================================================
  CHIEF COMPLAINT(s):  Feeling much better over last 24 hours.
 
  PRESENT ILLNESS:
The patient no longer has nausea; no vomiting X 36 hours; no fever X 24 hours; 
no more dysuria or urgency.  She is eager to go home. 
 
ALLERGIES: METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
  ==============================================================
  MEDICATIONS:
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Inpatient Medications                                  Status
=========================================================================
1)   AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM INJ AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM 1.5 GM   ACTIVE
       in DEXTROSE 5% IN WATER 50 ML  INFUSE OVER 15
       MINUTES IVP Q6H
2)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
3)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
4)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
5)   DEXT 5% NACL 0.9% INJ,SOLN in DEXTROSE 5%/0.9% SOD     ACTIVE
       CHLORIDE 1000 ML  75 ml/hr IV
6)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
7)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
9)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
10)  SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
11)  VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
   ==============================================================
  PHYSICAL EXAM:
Temp: 99 F 
BP: 136/66
HR:  78
Resp: 12
Pulse Oximetry: 91%
 
 
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, Obese female
NECK: absence of thyroid noted; no lymphadenopathy noted
HEART: RRR no M/R/G
LUNGS: CTAB no W/R/R
ABD: obese, NT, ND
BACK: no CVA tenderness
EXT: no LE edema
NEURO: patellar DTRs are normal bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior
 
  ==============================================================
LABS: 
06/01/12  6:30    GLUCOSE              109
06/01/12  6:30    UREA NITROGEN        33H
06/01/12  6:30    CREATININE           1.4
06/01/12  6:30    SODIUM               142
06/01/12  6:30    POTASSIUM            4.3
06/01/12  6:30    CHLORIDE             101
06/01/12  6:30    CO2                  30
06/01/12  6:30    WBC                  8.3
06/01/12  6:30    RBC                  4.25
06/01/12  6:30    HGB                  14.3
06/01/12  6:30    HCT                  43
06/01/12  6:30    MCV                  84.6
06/01/12  6:30    MCH                  29.1
06/01/12  6:30    MCHC                 34.4
06/01/12  6:30    RDW                  12
06/01/12  6:30    PLATELET COUNT       144
06/01/12  6:30    MPV                  7.5
06/01/12  6:30    BASOPHIL %           1
06/01/12  6:30    LYMPH %              23
06/01/12  6:30    NEUTROPHIL %         82
06/01/12  6:30    MONOCYTE %           5
06/01/12  6:30    EOSIN %              0
 
 
  ==============================================================
  ASSESSMENT AND CARE PLAN:
 
55  year old female with a pmh of   DM2, HTN , hyperlipidemia currently admitted 
with Pseudomonas Pyelonephritis.
1.      Pyelonephritis: doing better, change to oral ciprofloxacin.
2.      DM2: continue glyburide.
3.      HTN: continue lisinopril and chlorthalidone; BP fine.
4.      Disposition: will evaluate later today to see if doing well enough
text.author: USER,DOCTOR

text.content:
Nausea/vomiting with lunch.  Responded well with a single dose of Ondansetron. 
Will keep on IV antibiotics through the night, and D/C in am if tolerating diet.
text.author: PROVIDER,ONE
